sentences.en: An insulation material which could automatically spall off the equipment at excessive temperatures was introduced.
sentences.cn: 文章介绍了一种能够超温自动脱落的保温材料.

sentences.en: However, the alumina layers spall as the temperature increases.
sentences.cn: 但是, 氧化铝层剥落的温度升高.

sentences.en: That hole was caused by spall blow - out.
sentences.cn: 那个洞就是被碎片打穿的.

sentences.en: The spall that blew out the back caused the water jug to leak.
sentences.cn: 头盔背后爆出的碎片把水桶打的漏水了.

words.tran_cn: [核] 散裂；分裂；[核] 蜕变；碎裂

trans.tran_en: a splinter or chip of ore, rock, or stone
